hints.content:
To find how long the row of $\purpleD{\text{Daisies}}$ are, we need to add $\blueE{\text{Mini roses}}$ with the $\maroonD{\text{extra length}}$.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/5f9ed6ccfd55b7d91c2b95b32bbd9f7a35218f40)

$\blueE{49}\text{ cm}  + \maroonD{27}\text{ cm} =\purpleD{\square}\text{ cm}$

Let's add to find the total.

![](web+graphie://cdn.kastatic.org/ka-perseus-graphie/423593030147d9bcd4dbce515ee7185a18f780e3)

$\blueE{49}\text{ cm} + \maroonD{27}\text{ cm}=\purpleD{76}\text{ cm}$
The row of daisies is $\purpleD{76} \text{ cm}$ long.

question.content:
Gardener Tony has a $49\text{ cm}$ row of mini roses.  He also has a row of daisies that is $27$ $\text{cm}$ longer than the row of mini roses.  

**How long is the row of daisies?**  

[[â˜ƒ input-number 1]] $\text{cm}$
